虽然有一点烧脑（指决战前的隧道跳半天才想起来可以拿椅子）和一点刺激（指最后倒计时过于紧张），但看到最后的阳光与草地后不免心怀感慨，而且最后的歌曲实在太好听了，也非常符合整个剧情的流程与体验。

Çok güzel bir oyun daha bitirdim. "TEKRARDAN" kesinlikle tavsiye ediyorum. Sadece zeka ve zaman isteyen oyun. keşke biraz daha uzun olsaydı diyorum. Oyun bitiğinde sonda söylenen şarkıyı dinleyin ve solda dönen şarkı sözlerini okuyun. Half-Life gönderme var. Vede çok anlamlı sözler var. Bu oyunu bitirdikten sonra 2. de oynayın kesinlikle.
Oyun kısa gelebilir ama tam tekrara düştüğü yerde bitiyor 3.70 indirimde yani alın oynayın 3 saat bişi kaybetmezsiniz
Beat the entire game in 97 minutes, twas a good 97 minutes.

Don't miss this out, the origin of Portal from the womb of Half Life (it's basically an HL2 mod).
Not just to have the full picture because is really enjoyable and is important for our culture, as I said an important piece of the golden era of Source 2 engine and of Valve passion for innovation.
This game plays with u, makes the gameplay the poetry behind the story.
Few games can boast of this (from a lot of different genres, u know, mgs etc).

需要点空间感，对我这种空间感不强的人来说，上手有点难，玩到了十来关才算弄清了操作逻辑，弄懂之后玩着很不错，只是时间长了会有点晕。19关过了，看见高级地图就算啦，没那个操作和脑子。
Super satisfying i had more fun in this 3 hours than I did in 3000 hours in any other valve game

As someone who isn't at all into Puzzle games, Portal is one fantastic exception. 

Admittedly when I first bought the game, I was mainly invested in the Half Life series. Learning that Portal was loosely tied to Half Life's lore, I was eager to give the game a try. 

The best way to describe my experience was being pleasantly surprised. Although the game does at times pose a challenge, I didn't necessarily find myself stumped on progression often. The game also doesn't take itself too seriously. GladOS is a fantastic villain. She's sinister yet a lot of her dialogue and the scenarios she puts you through are hilarious. All the while, you can explore the Science facility to a degree to understand more about what she is and her intentions for you. 

The only downside to Portal 1 is that its length only lasts about 2-3 hours, even when you have to stop and think about how to overcome the problem. Fortunately, if you're looking for more from Portal, then I'd strongly recommend Portal 2 as it takes the best elements of the original and adds a lot more depth to the level design and the story.

Overall Portal is an excellent game period, regardless of whether or not you're into Puzzle games or Half Life.
To quote Kanye West's "4th Dimension", "She said I'm in the wrong hole, I said I'm lost (Uh, uh)"

A pretty interesting concept accompanied by witty writing and clever challenges results in a still really solid title. A must play if you find this remotely interesting, (aside from one puzzle near the end) I didn't see the need for any guides. Portal 2 is better but if you want to try either then this is a better starting point. Give it a try
